de.mrapp.android.adapter.expandablelist.selectable

Interface SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>

  • Type Parameters:
    GroupType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's group items
    ChildType - The type of the underlying data of the adapter's child items
    All Superinterfaces:
    Adapter<ExpandableListView>, java.lang.Cloneable, DataStructure, EnableStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, FilterableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, ItemStateExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, Loggable, Parameterizable, Restorable, java.io.Serializable, SortableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSelectableExpandableListAdapter, MultipleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation, SingleChoiceExpandableListAdapterImplementation

    public interface SelectableExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
extends ExpandableListAdapter<GroupType,ChildType>
    Defines the interface, an adapter, whose underlying data is managed as a list of arbitrary group and child items of which one or multiple items can be selected, must implement. Such an adapter's purpose is to provide the underlying data for visualization using a ExpandableListView widget.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • addSelectionListener

        void addSelectionListener(ExpandableListSelectionListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified when the selection of an item has been changed.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type ExpandableListSelectionListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeSelectionListener

        void removeSelectionListener(ExpandableListSelectionListener<GroupType,ChildType> listener)
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified when the selection of an item has been changed, anymore.
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type ExpandableListSelectionListener. The listener may not be null

      • isGroupSelected

        boolean isGroupSelected(int groupIndex)
        Returns, whether the group item, which belongs to a specific index, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group item, whose selection state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the group item, which belongs to the given index, is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isGroupSelected

        boolean isGroupSelected(GroupType group)
        Returns, whether a specific group item is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group item, whose selection state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • getSelectedGroupCount

        int getSelectedGroupCount()
        Returns the number of currently selected group items.
        Returns:
        The number of currently selected group items, as an Integer value

      • isChildSelected

        boolean isChildSelected(GroupType group,
                        int childIndex)
        Returns, whether the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose selection state should be returned, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose selection state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isChildSelected

        boolean isChildSelected(GroupType group,
                        ChildType child)
        Returns, whether a specific child item, which belongs to a specific group, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child item, whose selection state should be returned, belongs to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose selection state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isChildSelected

        boolean isChildSelected(int groupIndex,
                        int childIndex)
        Returns, whether the child item, which belongs to a specific index of a specific group, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item, whose selection state should be returned, belongs to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        childIndex - The index of the child item, whose selection state should be returned, as an Integer value. The index must be between 0 and the value of the method getChildCount(group):int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • isChildSelected

        boolean isChildSelected(int groupIndex,
                        ChildType child)
        Returns, whether a specific child item, which belongs to a specific group, is currently selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child item, whose selection state should be returned, belongs to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        child - The child item, whose selection state should be returned, as an instance of the generic type ChildType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        True, if the given group item is currently selected, false otherwise

      • getSelectedChildCount

        int getSelectedChildCount()
        Returns the number of currently selected child items.
        Returns:
        The number of currently selected child items, as an Integer value

      • getSelectedChildCount

        int getSelectedChildCount(int groupIndex)
        Returns the number of currently selected child items of the group, which belongs to a specific index.
        Parameters:
        groupIndex - The index of the group, the child items, which should be counted, belong to, as an Integer value. The value must be between 0 and the value of the method getGroupCount():int - 1, otherwise an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The number of currently selected child items of the group, which belongs to the given index, as an Integer value

      • getSelectedChildCount

        int getSelectedChildCount(GroupType group)
        Returns the number of currently selected child items of a specific group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group, the child items, which should be counted, belong to, as an instance of the generic type GroupType. The item may not be null. If the item does not belong to the adapter, a NoSuchElementException will be thrown
        Returns:
        The number of the currently selected child items of the given group, as an Integer value

      • isGroupSelectedOnClick

        boolean isGroupSelectedOnClick()
        Returns, whether a group item is selected, when it is clicked by the user, or not.
        Returns:
        True, if a group item is selected, when it is clicked by the user, false otherwise

        Sets, whether a group should be expanded automatically, when it is selected, or not.
        Parameters:

      • isGroupExpandedOnChildSelection

        boolean isGroupExpandedOnChildSelection()
        Returns, whether a group is expanded automatically, when one of its children is selected, or not.
        Returns:

      • expandGroupOnChildSelection

        void expandGroupOnChildSelection(boolean expandGroupOnChildSelection)
        Sets, whether a group should be expanded automatically, when one of its children is selected, or not.
        Parameters:
        expandGroupOnChildSelection - True, if a group should be expanded automatically, when one of its children is selected, false otherwise

      • getChoiceMode

        ChoiceMode getChoiceMode()
        Returns the choice mode of the adapter.
        Returns:
        The choice mode of the adapter as a value of the enum ChoiceMode. The choice mode may either be GROUPS_ONLY, CHILDREN_ONLY or GROUPS_AND_CHILDREN
